benchmark_details.name: Bridging ASR and LLMs for Dysarthric Speech Recognition: Benchmarking Self-Supervised and Generative Approaches
benchmark_details.overview: This study benchmarks self-supervised ASR models for dysarthric speech recognition, comparing their performance with LLM-enhanced decoding to improve transcription intelligibility.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically benchmark ASR architectures and integrate LLM-based decoding for dysarthric speech recognition to enhance intelligibility.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Cross-dataset generalization is poor, high WER increases on unseen data, and limited dysarthric speech data restricts robustness.

data.size: 21 hours for TORGO, 102.7 hours for UASpeech

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on transcription outputs compared to ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Lower WER and CER indicate better performance in recognizing dysarthric speech.
methodology.baseline_results: HuBERT-CTC (0.50 TORGO, 0.54 UASpeech); Whisper (0.38 TORGO, 0.40 UASpeech).
